speaker: CAST OF CHARACTERS
line: The Simpsons DAN CASTELLANETA as Homer Simpson JULIE KAVNER as Marge Simpson NANCY CARTWRIGHT as Bart Simpson YEARDLEY SMITH as Lisa Simpson Maggie Simpson Grandpa Simpson Guest Stars GILLIAN ANDERSON as Dana Scully DAVID DUCHOVNY as Fox Mulder LEONARD NIMOY as Himself Primary Characters HARRY SHEARER as Mr Burns and the 'Alien' HARRY SHEARER as Smithers HANK AZARIA as Chief Wiggum Moe Kent Brockman Dr Nick Riviera Reverend Lovejoy Secondary Characters Barney Gumbel Ned Flanders Krusty the Klown Groundskeeper Willy Dr Julius Hibbert Milhouse Jimbo Jones Santa's Little Helper Blink-and-You'll Miss Them Alf Donkey Kong Marvin the Martian Chewbacca

speaker: NIMOY
line: Hello, I'm Leonard Nimoy. The following tale of alien encounters is true. And by true, I mean false. It's all lies. But they're entertaining lies, and in the end, isn't that the real truth? The answer...is no. Our story begins on a Friday morning, in a little town called Springfield...

speaker: HOMER
line: T.G.I.F! Guys, I'm off to Moe's.

speaker: LENNY
line: But Homer, it's ten in the morning!

speaker: HOMER
line: Don't worry, I have a plan. I saw this in a movie about a bus that had to speed around the city, keeping its speed over fifty. And if its speed dropped, it would explode. I think it was called... "The Bus That Couldn't Slow Down." First, I hook this common VCR into the security camera system like so, then I insert this old videotape of us working on a continuous loop.

speaker: BURNS
line: So, another Friday is upon us. What will you be doing Smithers, something gay no doubt?

speaker: SMITHERS
line: What? What?

speaker: BURNS
line: You know, light-hearted, fancy-free, mothers lock up your daughters! Smithers is on the town! He he he!

speaker: SMITHERS
line: Ha ha ha! Exactly, sir. ha ha ha...

speaker: OLD MAN
line: Thank God it's Wednesday.

speaker: WOMAN
line: It's Friday.

speaker: OLD MAN
line: Uh oh, wrong pills. Uh, little help?

speaker: (AT NOISELAND ARCADE
line: "Friday meet Donkey Kong in person", Donkey Kong is smoking and scratching himself, without an audience.)

speaker: MAN
line: Sorry Donkey Kong, but you're just not a draw anymore. Hey, he's still got it!

speaker: MILHOUSE
line: 38, 39, 40 quarters. This better be good.

speaker: GAME
line: Game over. Please deposit 40 quarters.

speaker: MILHOUSE
line: What a rip!

speaker: DR HIBBERT
line: Thank God it's Friday! Hmm hmm hmm...

speaker: SENILE MAN
line: Hello? Hello?

speaker: MARGE
line: Bad dog! Bad cat! Bad Fawn! Hmmm...Shoo shoo!

speaker: LISA
line: All right! Time for ABC's T.G.I.F. line-up!

speaker: BART
line: Lise, when you get a little older, you'll realise that Friday is just another day between NBC's Must-See Thursday and CBS's Saturday night Crap-o-Rama.

speaker: MOE
line: Another Duff Homer?

speaker: HOMER
line: Nah, it's Friday night, Moe. I want to try something special.

speaker: MOE
line: Sure, sure. Here you go, DÃ¼ff. From Sweden, huh huh.

speaker: HOMER
line: Goal! Wait a minute, this is Duff!

speaker: MOE
line: Heh heh, you got me didn't you? Okay, here you go, Red Tick Beer.

speaker: HOMER
line: Cold, refreshing, and something I can't quite put my finger on.

speaker: TESTER
line: Hmm, needs more dog.

speaker: HOMER
line: Well, it's 1am. Better go home and spend some quality time with the kids.

speaker: MOE
line: Just a second, Homer. You gotta take a breathalyser test before I let you drive home.

speaker: HOMER
line: Uh. I guess I'll walk home. Ohh.. Aargh! Arrrgh! Ahhh!

speaker: GRANDPA
line: Oh, son I'm glad to see you. I went for the morning paper and I got lost.

speaker: HOMER
line: No time for you, old man!

speaker: HOMER
line: Please, don't hurt me!

speaker: ALIEN
line: Don't be afraid.

speaker: HOMER
line: Yahhh!

speaker: MARGE
line: Homer, it's 2am. What happened?

speaker: HOMER
line: It was an alien, Marge! It appeared in front of me and said, 'Don't be afraid'!

speaker: MARGE
line: Have you been drinking?

speaker: HOMER
line: No! Well, ten beers.

speaker: MARGE
line: Hmmm.

speaker: HOMER
line: I'm telling you, I saw a creature from another planet.

speaker: LISA
line: Maybe you just dreamed it.

speaker: HOMER
line: Oh yeah? Well when I came to I was covered with a sticky, translucent goo. Explain that!

speaker: MARGE
line: More sausage?

speaker: LISA
line: Dad, according to Junior Sceptics Magazine, the chances are 175 million to one of another form of life actually coming into contact with ours.

speaker: HOMER
line: So?

speaker: LISA
line: It's just that the people who claim to have seen aliens are always pathetic lowlifes with boring jobs. Oh..and you.. dad. Ha ha.

speaker: BART
line: I am the thing...from Uranus!

speaker: HOMER
line: Ahhh! Oh, it's Bart. I can't believe it. I'm being mocked, by my own children. On my birthday.

speaker: BART
line: It's your birthday?

speaker: HOMER
line: Yes. Remember? It's the same day as the dog's.

speaker: LISA
line: Santa's Little Helper, it's your birthday? Ooh, we've got to get you a present. Yes we do. Yes we do!

speaker: BART
line: We love you.

speaker: MARGE
line: Poor doggy. Poor doggy!

speaker: HOMER
line: Lousy loveable dog.

speaker: HOMER
line: Oh, it was awful. They sat me on a cold, metal table and prodded me with humiliating probes. Oh, wait, that was my physical.

speaker: LENNY
line: Nice going Homer, really.

speaker: HOMER
line: The alien has a sweet heavenly voice, like Urkel. And he appears every Friday night, like Urkel.

speaker: WIGGUM
line: Well your story is very compelling, Mr Jackass, I mean Simpson. So I'll just type it up on my invisible typewriter. Hmm hmm hmm...

speaker: HOMER
line: You don't have to humiliate me.

speaker: ARSONIST
line: I just torched a building downtown, and I'm afraid I'll do it again!

speaker: WIGGUM
line: Oh, yeah right. I'll just type it up on my invisible typewriter. Dum dum dum...fruitcake. FBI DIVISION OF PARANORMAL ACTIVITY WASHINGTON, D.C.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at this Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, gee Mulder. There's also this report of a shipment of drugs and illegal weapons coming into New Jersey tonight.

speaker: MULDER
line: I hardly think the FBI is concerned with matters like that. SIMPSON HOME SPRINGFIELD, USA

speaker: MARGE
line: Hello. Can I help you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agents Mulder and Scully. FBI.

speaker: MARGE
line: Is this about that pen that I took from the post office? I swear, I didn't know I put it in my purse, then I was going to bring it back but the dog chewed it up, and that just made things worse.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Actually, we're here to see your husband about his UFO encounter.

speaker: MARGE
line: Oh, good. Come...come in. Branch. Invading Your Privacy For 60 Years)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr Simpson, look at this line-up and tell us if any of these is the aliens you saw.

speaker: ALF
line: Yo!

speaker: HOMER
line: No, I'm sorry.

speaker: MARVIN
line: This makes me very angry!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now we're going to run a few tests. This is a simple liedetector. I'll ask you a few yes or no questions, and you just answer truthfully. Do you understand?

speaker: HOMER
line: Yes!

speaker: HOMER
line: Ohh!

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait a minute, Scully. What's the point of this test?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No point. I just thought he could stand to lose a little weight.

speaker: MULDER
line: His jiggling is almost hypnotic.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. It's like a lava lamp. MOE'S BAR TEMPERATURE 72 DEG C ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY. ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right Homer. We want you to recreate your every move the night you saw this alien.

speaker: HOMER
line: Well, the evening began at the Gentleman's club, where we were discussing Wittgenstein over a game of backgammon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr Simpson, it's a felony to lie to the FBI.

speaker: HOMER
line: We were sitting in Barney's car eating packets of mustard. You happy?

speaker: HOMER
line: You are one fine looking woman, lady. If I wasn't married, I'd go out with you like that! I am so sorry. Whatever you do, don't tell Marge. God I love her! Hey, a penny!

speaker: MOE
line: So uh, so what are you guys anyhow?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agents Mulder and Scully, FBI.

speaker: MOE
line: FBI, huh? Excuse me. All right, they're on to us. Get him back to Sea World.

speaker: HOMER
line: So I said, blue M&M, red M&M, they all wind up the same colour in the end.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr Simpson, why don't you show us where you went when you left the bar.

speaker: HOMER
line: I was standing right here, when the horrible creature emerged from the woods.

speaker: GRANDPA
line: God help me! I've been here for four days, and a turtle's got a hold of my teeth! There he is. Come back here, you! Shut up! I'll get you...

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is the worst assignment we've ever had.

speaker: MULDER
line: Worse than the time we were attacked by the flesh-eating virus?

speaker: GRANDPA
line: Ow, it bit me with my own teeth!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, this is much more irritating. I've seen enough Mulder, let's go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah okay. But somewhere out there, something is watching us. There are alien forces acting in ways we can't perceive. Are we alone in the universe? Impossible. When you consider the wonders that exist all around us, Voodoo priests of Haiti, Tibetan Numerologists of Appalachia. The unsolved mysteries of...unsolved mysteries. The truth...is out there!

speaker: MOE
line: Who would have thought a whale could be so heavy? Jeez it's the Feds!

speaker: HOMER
line: Oh Marge, I've never felt so alone. No one believes me. Uh, this is the part where you're supposed to say, "I believe you, Homer."

speaker: MARGE
line: I don't believe you, Homer.

speaker: HOMER
line: You do! Oh Marge, you've made me so happy.

speaker: MARGE
line: Homey, you're not listening. You're only hearing what you want to hear.

speaker: HOMER
line: Thanks, I'd love an omelette right about now.

speaker: MARGE
line: Homer, please! I try to be supportive, but this has gone to far. Please just let it be.

speaker: HOMER
line: No, I can't. This is my cause. I'm like the guy who single-handedly built the rocket and went to the moon. What's his name? Apollo 3?

speaker: MARGE
line: Please, let's just go to sleep.

speaker: HOMER
line: No, I refuse to share a bed with someone who thinks I'm crazy. Unless you're feeling... amorous. Rrrr!

speaker: MARGE
line: No I'm not.

speaker: HOMER
line: Well then, good night.

speaker: BART
line: Hey dad. What's the word, you planning crackpot?

speaker: HOMER
line: Oh, I suppose you're going to mock me too.

speaker: BART
line: Actually dad, I believe you.

speaker: HOMER
line: You do?

speaker: BART
line: Yes, I do. You seem so damn sure.

speaker: HOMER
line: Thank you son. And do you think you can stop the casual swearing?

speaker: BART
line: Hell yes.

speaker: HOMER
line: That's my boy. If you believe in me, then I'm not going to give up. I'll prove I'm right. This Friday we're going back to the woods and we're going to find that alien!

speaker: BART
line: What if we don't?

speaker: HOMER
line: We'll fake it and sell it to the Fox network.

speaker: BART
line: They'll buy anything.

speaker: HOMER
line: Now son, they do a lot of quality programming too. Haa haa haa! I kill me.

speaker: FROG1
line: Bud

speaker: FROG2
line: Weis

speaker: FROG3
line: Er

speaker: FROG1
line: Bud

speaker: FROG2
line: Weis

speaker: FROG3
line: Er

speaker: ALLIGATOR
line: Corrs

speaker: BART
line: Yo, dad can I have a sip of your beer?

speaker: HOMER
line: No son, you don't want to drink beer. That's for daddies and kids with fake ID's. Besides, it's such a beautiful night, how about a ghost story.

speaker: BART
line: ...And that, is how much college will cost for Maggie.

speaker: HOMER
line: No! No! No!

speaker: BART
line: You know dad, it doesn't matter that we didn't see the alien. I really had a great time out here.

speaker: HOMER
line: Yeah, me too. It's him!

speaker: ALIEN
line: I bring you peace.

speaker: HOMER
line: As a representative of Planet Earth, let me be the first to say... Ahhh! Whooo! Yarrgh!!

speaker: ALIEN
line: Ahhh!

speaker: HOMER
line: D'oh! It's gone. We still don't have any proof.

speaker: BART
line: Oh yes we do. I got it all on tape.

speaker: HOMER
line: Good work son! We did it! We did it!

speaker: NIMOY
line: And so from this simple man came the truth, that we are not alone in the universe. I'm Leonard Nimoy, good night.

speaker: TEENAGER
line: Uh Mr Nimoy, we have ten minutes left.

speaker: NIMOY
line: Oh, fine. Let me just get something out of my car.

speaker: TEENAGER
line: I don't think he's coming back.

speaker: BROCKMAN
line: News. A man who's been in a coma for 23 years wakes up.

speaker: MAN
line: Do Sonny and Cher still have that stupid show?

speaker: BROCKMAN
line: No, she won an Oscar, and he's a congressman.

speaker: MAN
line: Good night.

speaker: KENT
line: But first, ET phone Homer. Simpson, that is.

speaker: HOMER
line: Marge, kids, they're about to show our videotape!

speaker: BROCKMAN
line: Local man Homer Simpson, shown here with his tongue stuck to a lamp post, has given us this videotape. It's a close encounter, of the blurred kind. Ha ha ha.

speaker: ALIEN
line: I bring you peace.

speaker: BROCKMAN
line: The alien has appeared in the same Springfield pasture the last two Friday nights. Will it appear again this Friday? The entire channel six news team will be there, except for Phil, the boom mike operator, who's getting fired tomorrow. Ow! Very unprofessional, Phil.

speaker: BART
line: Well, Lise. What do you think about the alien now?

speaker: LISA
line: I think there must be a more logical explanation. And I think the people of this town aren't going to be won over by three seconds of videotape.

speaker: HOMER
line: I'm happy to answer any questions you have about the alien. Any questions at all. Dr Hibbert?

speaker: DR HIBBERT
line: Yes, is the alien carbon based or silicon based?

speaker: HOMER
line: Uh, the second one. Zillophone. Next question.

speaker: BARNEY
line: Is the alien Santa Claus?

speaker: HOMER
line: Uh, yes.

speaker: FLANDERS
line: Were you on my roof last night stealing my weather vane?

speaker: HOMER
line: This interview is over!

speaker: REVEREND LOVEJOY
line: I remember another gentle visitor from the heavens, he came in peace,and then died. Only to come back to life. His name was... FRIDAY

speaker: BART
line: Leonard Nimoy! What are you doing here?

speaker: NIMOY
line: Wherever there is a mystery or something unexplained, cosmic forces shall draw me near.

speaker: BOY
line: Hey, Spock, what do you want in your hot dog?

speaker: NIMOY
line: Surprise me.

speaker: HOMER
line: Take a look at this Lisa. You don't see any "Homer is a Dope" T-shirts, do you?

speaker: BOY
line: We sold those out in five minutes.

speaker: HOMER
line: D'oh! Marge, how could you?

speaker: MARGE
line: These shirts are 100% cotton, and look at the fine stitching on "Dope".

speaker: HOMER
line: I'll take two.

speaker: KRUSTY
line: Ahhh!

speaker: HOMER
line: Look. There it is!

speaker: MARGE
line: Oh, Homey. Honey I'm so sorry I doubted you.

speaker: ALIEN
line: I bring you love.

speaker: DR HIBBERT
line: Is that the love between a man and a woman, or the love of a man for a fine Cuban cigar?

speaker: ALIEN
line: Ah, I bring you love.

speaker: LENNY
line: It's bringing love, don't let it get away!

speaker: WILLY
line: Break its legs!

speaker: LISA
line: Wait! You want an alien? This is your alien!

speaker: MR BURNS
line: Hello, children. I bring you love.

speaker: WILLY
line: It's a monster! Kill it! Kill it!

speaker: SMITHERS
line: It's not a monster, it's Mr Burns.

speaker: WILLY
line: Oh, it's Mr Burns. Kill it!

speaker: SMITHERS
line: No, let me explain. Every Friday evening after work Mr Burns undergoes a series of medical treatments designed to cheat death for another week. First Mr Burns' chiropractors perform a slight spinal adjustment. Then a team of doctors administer his eye drops, pain killers, and a vocal cord straightening.

speaker: DR NICK
line: Don't worry, you won't feel a thing. Till I jam this down your throat!

speaker: SMITHERS
line: The whole ordeal leaves Mr Burns twisted and disoriented.

speaker: DR NICK
line: The most rewarding part was when he gave me my money.

speaker: BART
line: But what's with the glowing?

speaker: MR BURNS
line: Um, I'll field that question. A lifetime of working in a nuclear power plant has given me a healthy green glow. And left me as impotent as a Nevada Boxing Commissioner. And now that I'm back to normal, I don't bring you peace and love, I bring you fear, famine, pestilence, and -

speaker: DR NICK
line: Time for a booster!

speaker: MR BURNS
line: Good morning star shine. The Earth says hello...

speaker: NIMOY
line: They twinkle above us, we twinkle below.

speaker: CHORUS
line: Good morning star shine....

speaker: MARGE
line: Well, you said you'd bring us peace and love, and it looks like you did it. I'm proud of you Homey.

speaker: HOMER
line: Thanks Marge.

speaker: TEENAGER
line: And so concludes our tale. I'm Leonard Nimoy. Goodnight, and keep watching the skis. Uh, skies. This production has not been approved, endorsed, or authorized by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
